page.title: 01Morwenstow Gazetteer
page.content: This block covers most of the northern half of{Morwenstow,}the most northerly parish in Cornwall. The land lies mainly some 400 to 600 feet above sea level, though there are beaches in the north west, notably at{Yeolmouth.}The main centre of population is at{Shop, where most of the parish amenities are situated. There are other small com- munities at{Crosstown}and{Gooseham}and a number of scattered farm houses. The main occupation is farming, although several residents commute from{Shop, etc., to jobs in{Bude}and other neigh- bouring areas. Here it is often windswept and bleak in winter, but in summer many tourists are attracted. Some visit the church, drawn particularly by its association with {R.S.Hawker; }others pass through as they travel the {North Cornwall {Coastal Footpath.
